title: MAG 091 - The Coming Storm Transcript
text:
? Not to become 
as I am now. Perhaps I just didn’t know the true joy of vertigo. It doesn’t 
matter. In the end I threw myself into the arms of that vast emptiness, and I 
bound my tormentor to the book. 
That’s… that’s all, I think. Since then I’ve embraced my new life; gladly fed that 
which feeds me. 
A… uh, a Paris skyscraper, was it you said? I honestly, I, I can’t say I recall it in 
detail, but that does… sounds about right. Sometimes it’s hard to keep track. 
MIKE 
Hm. You know, that was… that was nice. I’m not, not usually the sort for 
speeches. That was… pleasant change. So. 
[The sound of rushing air as the Archivist gasps for breath] 
Off you go, then. 
ARCHIVIST 
I, er… You – 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
9 
 
MIKE 
Archivist. Take my mercy and leave. You have touched something few ever 
walk away – 
[Someone knocks at the door] 
I thought you said you came alone? Hm. 
[Mike opens the door] 
Can I hel– UGHH! 
[Sounds of a scuffle.] 
ARCHIVIST 
Detect… Detective? 
DAISY 
Shut up. He human? 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
DAISY 
Is this man human? 
ARCHIVIST 
I… Er, no, I, I don’t think so. Not anymore. 
DAISY 
Right. What does it do? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
10 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Er, he… It feels like, he makes you… Vertigo. Like you’re falling. 
DAISY 
Has he killed people? 
ARCHIVIST 
Er, y-y-yes. Yes, a few, I think. 
DAISY 
Does he need to see you to do it? Does he need to speak? 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I-I don’t know. 
DAISY 
Okay. 
[The sound of kicking] 
Doubt he can do it in a coma. Now turn that off, and help me get him in the 
car. Don’t try to run. 
ARCHIVIST 
What are you – 
[Daisy punches the Archivist] 
DAISY 
What did I say about questions? I said turn that off! 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
11 
 
[Tape clicks off. Tape clicks on. There’s the sound of wind, as if outside. 
Voices are muffled.] 
DAISY 
This is it. 
ARCHIVIST 
So… so what now? You kill us? 
DAISY 
You think he’s going to save you? 
ARCHIVIST 
What? What, no – 
[The sound of a gun being fired. The Archivist shouts in surprise.] 
DAISY 
Now… let’s see the bag. 
[The bag is unzipped] 
DAISY 
One wallet, brown leather, no cash. One packet cigarettes, Silk Cut. One 
lighter, gold, spiderweb design. One pocket knife… blunt. Huh. One set of keys 
to the Magnus Institute. And one tape record- 
[The voices become clearer as she finds the recorder.] 
You sneaky little freak! You want to record this? Alright. I’d have to destroy it 
anyway. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
12 
 
ARCHIVIST 
What, I? I, I didn’t – Pl-please don’t shoot me. Why are you doing this? Tell me! 
[The Archvist makes a gurgling noise, as if Daisy has grabbed him around the 
neck.] 
DAISY 
Stop… asking… questions! That’s how you want it? Fine. You brought a knife. 
So we go through the voicebox. 
BASIRA 
Daisy! Daisy, put him down. 
DAISY 
You been following me, Basira? 
BASIRA 
Didn’t need to. I know what you do here. 
DAISY 
He tell you? 
BASIRA 
He didn’t need to. You’re not that subtle. But I – I always thought you just 
killed monsters. 
DAISY 
I do! 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
13 
 
[Sounds of someone struggling] 
BASIRA 
Just let him go. 
DAISY 
You don’t know what he is. You don’t know what it’s like to have your secrets 
pulled out like teeth, just because he asked? 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m sorry, I didn’t – 
DAISY 
Shut up! 
BASIRA 
Daisy! 
DAISY 
Don’t you… Don’t you dare look at me like I’m crazy! It got you too, or do you 
think we gave him those tapes because we like handing out evidence? 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
BASIRA 
That’s not how it happened. 
DAISY 

The Magnus Archives – MAG091 – The Coming Storm 
14 
 
No? You ask me to take a tape over to this murdering freak, and I’m all set to 
tear you a new one for it. But then I get the cassette in my hand, and suddenly 
all I want to do is deliver his tapes, and spill my guts. 
BASIRA 
So, so now you kill him? 
DAISY 
First him, then his creepy boss. 
BASIRA 
This is too far, Daisy. You know it is. 
DAISY 
He murdered two people, Basira. Maybe more. I’ve done one monster today, 
no reason not to do another. 
ARCHIVIST 
I didn’t… I didn’t kill anyone! 
BASIRA 
For god’s sake look at him! 
DAISY 
Then who? 
ARCHIVIST 
I thi- I thi- I think it was Elias.
